title: How to write a love confession letter - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok…goes like this. Start with a heart. Then write your ransom letter. YES, ransom letter. In this letter you will tell her that you have stolen a can of pringles from her house. And she will fall in love with you if she ever wants these Pringles back in one piece ….? Or…52 pieces…not like a soggy ball of pringles...i think thats how they make Bri Cheese- No…cows…oh, the cow chews the pringles…so stupid. They're still watching you dude. Make it count...theyre invested now. Tell her if she doesnt want her Pringles crushed…she will find you of adequate suitor type as well. Look little homie…all I know is no chick is gonna allow a whole can of pringles to turn to crumbs. Its failproof Ok I'll be honest…I'm kinda phoning it in here. 600 questions answered…I needed to play. All work and no play…ah nm thats way before you. Ok…litterally be honest…be vauge, leave alittle room for interpretation both to weasle away if you need and to not have your letter become a post on Facebook if it turns out shes an ice queen. If you make it short, its got more running time. Time for her to think on and ponder…change her mind..be all in and crushin on you too. Thats the ultimate happy is when you write heart and love responds. You dont tell her about your inflated visions of how you see her, no dreaming about her nightly, definately nothing else nightly in her thought.…but its acceptable to leave a couple compliments and an “on the nose” over-statement if you can make it funny. Do not tell her shes the only one. You should think of this in two letters b. Try one letter expressing intrest.. And that you think shes beautiful...and since you would memorize everything they say, go ahead and say your intrested in getting to know her. You wanna be knowledgable this goes either really really well, kinda awkward, or sorta bad. Now if your an adult and this is for the misses…let us know. I'll write the same thing at 3 different grades to suite closest to yalls dialect or overtly the attic and whimsical
